required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of Efficacy and Safety of Canakinumab in Patients With Hereditary Periodic Fevers
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo Controlled Study of Canakinumab in Patients With Hereditary Periodic Fevers (TRAPS, HIDS, or crFMF), With Subsequent Randomized Withdrawal/Dosing Frequency Reduction and Open-label Long-term Treatment Epochs

brief_summary.textblock: This study is to determine whether canakinumab is able to induce and maintain a clinically meaningful reduction of disease activity in participants with Hereditary Periodic Fevers (HPF) compared to placebo.

detailed_description.textblock:
This study consists of 3 randomized cohorts (one per condition of colchicine resistant/intolerant Familial Mediterranean Fever (crFMF), Hyper Immunoglobulin D Syndrome (also known as mevalonate kinase deficiency (HIDS/MKD), and Tumor Necrosis Factor Receptor Associated Periodic Syndrome (TRAPS), and 4 study epochs:
1. Epoch 1: a screening epoch to assess participant's eligibility;
2. Epoch 2: a randomized treatment epoch of 16 weeks where participants are randomized to canakinumab 150 mg every 4 weeks (q4w) or to placebo to obtain efficacy and safety data in a double-blind placebo controlled parallel-arm setting. This epoch contained 2 possible escape options :
1. early blinded escape option for non responders from Day 8 to Day 28 with here an add-on dose of 150mg canakinumab followed by blinded uptitration at the next scheduled visit (Day 29)
2. late unblinded escape option for non responders from Day 29 to Day 112; with open-label uptitration
3. Epoch 3: a randomized withdrawal epoch of 24 weeks where canakinumab responders from the randomized treatment epoch were re-randomized to canakinumab 150mg q8w or placebo to assess the potential for canakinumab to maintain clinical efficacy at a reduced dosing frequency;
4. Epoch 4: an open-label treatment epoch of 72 weeks to collect long-term

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Resolution of Initial Flare and Absence of New Flares up to the End of the Randomized Treatment Epoch (16 Weeks)
primary_outcome.description: Resolution of the initial disease flare is defined as: Physician's Global Assessment of Disease activity (PGA) <2 and C-reactive protein (CRP) within normal range (<= 10 mg/L) or reduction by at least 70% from baseline. The PGA was evaluated by the investigator based on a 5-point scale: 0 = None (no) disease associated with clinical signs and symptoms; 1 = minimal disease associated signs and symptoms; 2 = mild disease associated signs and symptoms; 3 = moderate disease associated signs and symptoms; and 5 = severe disease associated signs and symptoms.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Achieve Physician's Global Assessment (PGA) < 2
secondary_outcome.description: The PGA was evaluated by the investigator based on a 5-point scale: 0 = None (no) disease associated with clinical signs and symptoms; 1 = minimal disease associated signs and symptoms; 2 = mild disease associated signs and symptoms; 3 = moderate disease associated signs and symptoms; and 5 = severe disease associated signs and symptoms.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With the Serologic Remission
secondary_outcome.description: Serologic remission was defined as C-reactive protein <= 10 mg/L.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Normalized Serum Amyloid A (SAA) Level
secondary_outcome.description: Normalized SAA was defined as SAA <= 10 mg/L.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants of Canakinumab Responders From Epoch 2 Who Maintained a Clinically Meaningful Response (Absence of New Flares) (40 Weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: A responder was defined as a participant who had no flare between week 16 and week 40.

arm_group.description: During Epoch 2, participants received canakinumab 150mg (or 2mg/kg for participants weighing <= 40kg) q4w for 16 weeks. If participants were eligible for blinded escape, they received a single add-on dose of canakinumab (150 mg or 2mg/kg for participants weighing <= 40kg) between day 8 and day 28, and then received blinded uptitration to canakinumab 300 mg q4w from day 29 through day 112. If patients on the highest allowed canakinumab dose of 300 mg (or 4 mg/kg for patients weighing ≤ 40 kg) q4w and re-flared (PGA ≥ 2 and CRP ≥ 30 mg/L) were not eligible for further up-titration.

During epoch 2, participants received matching placebo to canakinumab 150 mg Participants who required blinded escape,they received a single add-on dose of canakinumab (150 mg or 2mg/kg for participants weighing <= 40kg) between day 8 and day 28, and then received blinded one dose of placebo and one dose of canakinumab q4w from day 29 through day 112. If flare or re-flare still occurred after receipt of canakinumab. 150mg, participants were uptitrated to open-label canakinumab 300 mg.

During Epoch 2, participants received canakinumab 150mg (or 2mg/kg for participants weighing <= 40kg) q4w for 16 weeks. If participants were eligible for blinded escape, they received a single add-on dose of canakinumab (150 mg or 2mg/kg for participants weighing <= 40kg) between day 8 and day 28, and then received blinded uptitration to canakinumab 300 mg q4w from day 29 through day 112. If patients on the highest allowed canakinumab dose of 300 mg (or 4 mg/kg for patients weighing ≤ 40 kg) q4w and re-flared (PGA ≥ 2 and CRP ≥ 30 mg/L) were not eligible for further up-titration.

During epoch 2, participants received matching placebo to canakinumab 150 mg qw4. Participants who required blinded escape, they received a single add-on dose of canakinumab (150 mg or 2mg/kg for participants weighing <= 40kg) between day 8 and day 28 and then received blinded one dose of placebo and one dose of canakinumab q4w from day 29 through day 112. If flare or re-flare still occurred after receipt of canakinumab 150mg, participants were uptitrated to open-label canakinumab 300 mg.

During Epoch 2, participants received canakinumab 150mg (or 2mg/kg for participants weighing <= 40kg) q4w for 16 weeks. If participants were eligible for blinded escape, they received a single add-on dose of canakinumab (150 mg or 2mg/kg for participants weighing <= 40kg) between day 8 and day 28, and then received blinded uptitration to canakinumab 300 mg q4w from day 29 through day 112. If patients on the highest allowed canakinumab dose of 300 mg (or 4 mg/kg for patients weighing ≤ 40 kg) q4w and re-flared (PGA ≥ 2 and CRP ≥ 30 mg/L) were not eligible for further up-titration

During epoch 2, participants received matching placebo to canakinumab 150 mg qw4. Participants who required blinded escape,they received a single add-on dose of canakinumab (150 mg or 2mg/kg for participants weighing <= 40kg) between Day 8 and 28 and then received blinded one dose of placebo and one dose of canakinumab q4w from day 29 through day 112. If flare or re-flare still occurred after receipt of canakinumab 150mg, participants were uptitrated to open-label canakinumab 300 mg.

intervention.description: Canakinumab solution for subcutaneous injection in vial which contained 150mg/mL canakinumab in 1 mL solution.
Matching placebo to canakinumab solution for subcutaneous injection

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria: - Patient's written informed consent (or parent's written informed consent in case of pediatric patient) at screening - Male and female patients at least 2 years of age at the time of the screening visit. Male and female patients >28 days but <2 years eligible for open label treatment only. - Confirmed diagnosis and active flare at randomization - CRP >10mg/L at randomization
Exclusion Criteria: - Use of the following therapies (within varying protocol defined timeframes): Corticosteroids, anakinra, canakinumab, rilonacept, tocilizumab, TNF inhibitors, abatacept, tofacitinib, rituximab, leflunomide, thalidomide, cyclosporine, intravenous immunoglobulin, 6-Merceptopurine, azathioprine, cyclophosphamide, or chlorambucil, any other investigational biologics - History of malignancy of any organ system (other than localized basal cell carcinoma of the skin or in - situ cervical cancer), treated or untreated - Significant medical diseases, including but not limited to the following: a. History of organ transplantation b. Elevated liver enzymes ≥3x ULN d. Increase in total bilirubin e. Serious hepatic disorder (Child-Pugh scores B or C) f. Chronic Kidney Disease g. Thyroid disease h. Diagnosis of active peptic ulcer disease i. Coagulopathy j. Significant CNS effects including vertigo and dizziness - Any conditions or significant medical problems which immunecompromise the patient and/or places the patient at unacceptable risk for immunomodulatory therapy - Live vaccinations within 3 months prior to the start of the trial, during the trial, and up to 3 months following the last dose

clinical_study.keyword: Canakinumab, interleukin-1, Hereditary Periodic Fevers, auto-inflammatory diseases

participant_flow.recruitment_details: This study consists of 4 study epochs. A total of 203 participants ((181randomized + 4 non-randomized open-label participants in Epoch 2) + (18 TRAPS rollover participants from ACZ885D2203 (NCT01242813) and ACZ885D2207M in Epoch 3)) have been enrolled into this study.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: 126 patients, randomized in Epoch 2, were not re-randomized in Epoch 3. These patients were switched to open-label (OL) treatment. Six patients discontinued OL treatment (1 due to physician decision, 1 due to subject/guardian decision, 3 due to lack of efficacy and 1 due to an adverse event).

group.title: Epoch 2: Non-randomized Open Label Treatment - crFMF
group.description: Canakinumab-naïve Japanese patients with non-exon 10 mutations received open-label canakinumab 150 mg (or 2 mg/kg for patients weighing ≤ 40 kg) q4w .

group.title: Epoch 2: Non-randomized Open Label HIDS/MKD
group.description: Participants in the 28 days to less than 2 years old cohort who received open-label canakinumab 150 mg (or 2mg/kg for patients weighing ≤ 40 kg) q4w.

group.title: Epoch 2 (Epoch 3) - Non-randomized Open Label TRAPS
group.description: Open-label treatment in Epoch 3 was initiated for TRAPS patients who rolled over from CACZ885D2203 or CACZ885D2207M.

group.title: Epoch 3: crFMF Re-randomized From Epoch 2 - 150 mg
group.description: Canakinumab responders who were initially randomized to canakinumab 150 mg q4w and did not re-flare in Epoch 2 were re-randomized at the start of Epoch 3 to canakinumab 150 mg q8w for 24 weeks.

group.title: Epoch 3: crFMF Re-randomized From Epoch 2 - Placebo
group.description: Canakinumab responders who were initially randomized to canakinumab 150 mg q4w and did not re-flare in Epoch 2 were re-randomized at the start of Epoch 3 to placebo for 24 weeks.

group.title: Epoch 3: HIDs/MKD Re-randomized From Epoch 2 - 150 mg
group.description: Canakinumab responders who were initially randomized to canakinumab 150 mg q4w and did not re-flare in Epoch 2 were re-randomized at the start of Epoch 3 to canakinumab 150 mg q8w for 24 weeks.

group.title: Epoch 3: HIDS/MKD Re-randomized From Epoch 2 - Placebo
group.description: Canakinumab responders who were initially randomized to canakinumab 150 mg q4w and did not re-flare in Epoch 2 were re-randomized at the start of Epoch 3 to placebo for 24 weeks.

group.title: Epoch 3: TRAPS Re-randomized From Epoch 2 - 150 mg
group.description: Canakinumab responders who were initially randomized to canakinumab 150 mg q4w and did not re-flare in Epoch 2 were re-randomized at the start of Epoch 3 to canakinumab 150 mg q8w for 24 weeks.

group.title: Epoch 3: TRAPS Re-randomized From Epoch 2 - Placebo
group.description: Canakinumab responders who were initially randomized to canakinumab 150 mg q4w and did not re-flare in Epoch 2 were re-randomized at the start of Epoch 3 to placebo for 24 weeks.

group.title: Epoch 3: crFMF, HIDS/MKD, TRAPS - Not Re-randomized
group.description: All Epoch 2 non-responders were switched to canakinumab q8w at the start of Epoch 3 for 24 weeks,

group.title: Epoch 4: crFMF - Open Label Cumulative Dose <2700 mg
group.description: During epoch 4, participants received open label treatment according to the dose regimen administered in epoch 3. Cumulative dose received was less than 2700 mg.

group.title: Epoch 4: crFMF - Open Label Cumulative Dose 2700 mg - <5400 mg
group.description: During epoch 4, participants received open label treatment according to the dose regimen administered in epoch 3. Cumulative dose received was >= 2700 mg and < 5400 mg.

group.title: Epoch 4: crFMF - Open Label Cumulative Dose >=5400 mg
group.description: During epoch 4, participants received open label treatment according to the dose regimen administered in epoch 3. Cumulative dose received was > 5400 mg.

group.title: Epoch 4: HIDS/MKD - Open Label Cumulative Dose <2700 mg
group.description: During epoch 4, participants received open label treatment according to the dose regimen administered in epoch 3. Cumulative dose received was less than 2700 mg.

group.title: Epoch 4: HIDS/MKD - OL Cumulative Dose 2700 - <=5400 mg
group.description: During epoch 4, participants received open label treatment according to the dose regimen administered in epoch 3. Cumulative dose received was >= 2700 mg and < 5400 mg.

group.title: Epoch 4: HIDS/MKD - Open Label Cumulative Dose >=5400 mg
group.description: During epoch 4, participants received open label treatment according to the dose regimen administered in epoch 3. Cumulative dose received was > 5400 mg.

group.title: Epoch 4: TRAPS - Open Label Cumulative Dose < 2700 mg
group.description: During epoch 4, participants received open label treatment according to the dose regimen administered in epoch 3. Cumulative dose received was less than 2700 mg.

group.title: Epoch 4: TRAPS - Open Label Cumulative Dose 2700 - <5400 mg
group.description: During epoch 4, participants received open label treatment according to the dose regimen administered in epoch 3. Cumulative dose received was >= 2700 mg and < 5400 mg.

group.title: Epoch 4: TRAPS - Open Label Cumulative Dose >=5400 mg
group.description: During epoch 4, participants received open label treatment according to the dose regimen administered in epoch 3. Cumulative dose received was > 5400 mg.

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Resolution of Initial Flare and Absence of New Flares up to the End of the Randomized Treatment Epoch (16 Weeks)
outcome.description: Resolution of the initial disease flare is defined as: Physician's Global Assessment of Disease activity (PGA) <2 and C-reactive protein (CRP) within normal range (<= 10 mg/L) or reduction by at least 70% from baseline. The PGA was evaluated by the investigator based on a 5-point scale: 0 = None (no) disease associated with clinical signs and symptoms; 1 = minimal disease associated signs and symptoms; 2 = mild disease associated signs and symptoms; 3 = moderate disease associated signs and symptoms; and 5 = severe disease associated signs and symptoms.
outcome.population: The Full Analysis Set (FAS), which consisted of all randomized participants in the randomized treatment epoch who received at least one dose of study drug in Epoch 2, was analyzed.

measure.description: Resolution of the initial disease flare is defined as: Physician's Global Assessment of Disease activity (PGA) <2 and C-reactive protein (CRP) within normal range (<= 10 mg/L) or reduction by at least 70% from baseline. The PGA was evaluated by the investigator based on a 5-point scale: 0 = None (no) disease associated with clinical signs and symptoms; 1 = minimal disease associated signs and symptoms; 2 = mild disease associated signs and symptoms; 3 = moderate disease associated signs and symptoms; and 5 = severe disease associated signs and symptoms.
measure.population: The Full Analysis Set (FAS), which consisted of all randomized participants in the randomized treatment epoch who received at least one dose of study drug in Epoch 2, was analyzed.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Who Achieve Physician's Global Assessment (PGA) < 2
outcome.description: The PGA was evaluated by the investigator based on a 5-point scale: 0 = None (no) disease associated with clinical signs and symptoms; 1 = minimal disease associated signs and symptoms; 2 = mild disease associated signs and symptoms; 3 = moderate disease associated signs and symptoms; and 5 = severe disease associated signs and symptoms.
outcome.population: The Full Analysis Set (FAS), which consisted of all randomized participants in the randomized treatment epoch who received at least one dose of study drug in Epoch 2, was analyzed.

group.title: Epoch 2: crFMF: 150 mg
group.description: During Epoch 2, participants received canakinumab 150mg (or 2mg/kg for participants weighing <= 40kg) q4w for 16 weeks. If participants were eligible for blinded escape, they received a single add-on dose of canakinumab (150 mg or 2mg/kg for participants weighing <= 40kg) between day 8 and day 28, and then received blinded uptitration to canakinumab 300 mg q4w from day 29 through day 112. If patients on the highest allowed canakinumab dose of 300 mg (or 4 mg/kg for patients weighing ≤ 40 kg) q4w and re-flared (PGA ≥ 2 and CRP ≥ 30 mg/L) were not eligible for further up-titration.

group.title: Epoch 2: crCMF: Placebo
group.description: During epoch 2, participants received matching placebo to canakinumab 150 mg Participants who required blinded escape,they received a single add-on dose of canakinumab (150 mg or 2mg/kg for participants weighing <= 40kg) between day 8 and day 28, and then received blinded one dose of placebo and one dose of canakinumab q4w from day 29 through day 112. If flare or re-flare still occurred after receipt of canakinumab. 150mg, participants were uptitrated to open-label canakinumab 300 mg

group.title: Epoch 2: HIDS/MKD: 150 mg
group.description: During Epoch 2, participants received canakinumab 150mg (or 2mg/kg for participants weighing <= 40kg) q4w for 16 weeks. If participants were eligible for blinded escape, they received a single add-on dose of canakinumab (150 mg or 2mg/kg for participants weighing <= 40kg) between day 8 and day 28, and then received blinded uptitration to canakinumab 300 mg q4w from day 29 through day 112. If patients on the highest allowed canakinumab dose of 300 mg (or 4 mg/kg for patients weighing ≤ 40 kg) q4w and re-flared (PGA ≥ 2 and CRP ≥ 30 mg/L) were not eligible for further up-titration.

group.title: Epoch 2: TRAPS: Placebo
group.description: During epoch 2, participants received matching placebo to canakinumab 150 mg qw4. Participants who required blinded escape,they received a single add-on dose of canakinumab (150 mg or 2mg/kg for participants weighing <= 40kg) between Day 8 and 28 and then received blinded one dose of placebo and one dose of canakinumab q4w from day 29 through day 112. If flare or re-flare still occurred after receipt of canakinumab 150mg, participants were uptitrated to open-label canakinumab 300 mg.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants Who Achieve Physician's Global Assessment (PGA) < 2
measure.description: The PGA was evaluated by the investigator based on a 5-point scale: 0 = None (no) disease associated with clinical signs and symptoms; 1 = minimal disease associated signs and symptoms; 2 = mild disease associated signs and symptoms; 3 = moderate disease associated signs and symptoms; and 5 = severe disease associated signs and symptoms.
measure.population: The Full Analysis Set (FAS), which consisted of all randomized participants in the randomized treatment epoch who received at least one dose of study drug in Epoch 2, was analyzed.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With the Serologic Remission
outcome.description: Serologic remission was defined as C-reactive protein <= 10 mg/L.
outcome.population: The Full Analysis Set (FAS), which consisted of all randomized participants in the randomized treatment epoch who received at least one dose of study drug in Epoch 2, was analyzed.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants of Canakinumab Responders From Epoch 2 Who Maintained a Clinically Meaningful Response (Absence of New Flares) (40 Weeks)
outcome.description: A responder was defined as a participant who had no flare between week 16 and week 40.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants of Canakinumab Responders From Epoch 2 Who Maintained a Clinically Meaningful Response (Absence of New Flares) (40 Weeks)
measure.description: A responder was defined as a participant who had no flare between week 16 and week 40.

reported_events.desc: Cohort groups were analyzed according to the occurrence of events corresponding to treatments given during epochs 2, 3 and 4. 'No medication' events cover events that occurred during epoch 4 when no treatment was given.

group.title: Non-randomized Open Label crFMF, HIDS/MKD Patients
group.description: Canakinumab-naïve Japanese patients with non-exon 10 mutations with cr-FMF who received open-label canakinumab 150 mg (or 2 mg/kg for patients weighing ≤ 40 kg) q4w; and patients in the 28 days to less than 2 years old cohort with HIDS/MKD who received open-label canakinumab 150 mg (or 2mg/kg for patients weighing ≤ 40 kg) q4w

group.title: Non-randomized Open Label TRAPS Patients
group.description: Open-label treatment in Epoch 3 was initiated for TRAPS patients who rolled over from CACZ885D2203 or CACZ885D2207M

group.title: Randomized ACZ and Placebo TRAPS Patients – Placebo Events
group.description: Patients who received ACZ885 and/or placebo during epoch 2 and/or epoch 3.

event.sub_title: Tumour necrosis factor receptor-associated periodic syndrome
Tumour necrosis factor receptor-associated periodic syndrome

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The terms and conditions of Novartis' agreements with its investigators may vary. However, Novartis does not prohibit any investigator from publishing. Any publications from a single-site are postponed until the publication of the pooled data (i.e., data from all sites) in the clinical trial or disclosure of trial results in their entirety.
